info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Schenectady, northeastern Albany, southeastern Saratoga, southwestern Washington and northern Rensselaer Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mechanicville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Troy, Clifton Park, Cohoes, Mechanicville, Hoosick Falls, Latham, Green Island, Grafton, Waterford, Center Brunswick, Country Knolls, Halfmoon, Brunswick, Hoosick, Lee, Pittstown, Stillwater, Schaghticoke and Valley Falls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between exits 6 and 7, and between exits 8A and 10. Interstate 787 near exit 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central New York.
